figure_1.title: Figure 1.
figure_1.caption: Flowchart of scientometric analysis process in breast cancer immunotherapy resistance study.

figure_2.title: Figure 2.
figure_2.caption: Annual publications, citations and respective cumulative values in the field of breast cancer immunotherapy resistance from 2003 to 2024. (A) Annual publications. (B) Annual citations (AGR, Annual growth rate).

figure_3.title: Figure 3.
figure_3.caption: Distribution of countries and collaboration in immunotherapy resistance research for breast cancer treatment. (A) world map of productive countries’ distribution. (B) overlay map of countries’ average publication year.

figure_4.title: Figure 4.
figure_4.caption: Source production on breast cancer immunotherapeutic resistance over time.

figure_5.title: Figure 5.
figure_5.caption: Dual-map of journals from citing documents to cited references.

figure_6.title: Figure 6.
figure_6.caption: Co-citation analysis of cited references. (A) Network map of co-cited references. (B) Trend, centrality, citation burst and keyword clustering analysis of co-cited references.

figure_7.title: Figure 7.
figure_7.caption: Cluster analysis and topic evolution of hot topics. (A) Network map of keywords occurring more than 5 times. (B, C) Overlay map of keywords based on average publication year. (D) Top 25 keywords with the strongest citation bursts.

claims.sentence:
Figure 1
 presents a flowchart depicting the retrieval strategy, data collection and analysis process employed in this study.

Publication and citation trends of breast cancer immunotherapy resistance


Figure 2
 presents the annual trends in breast cancer immunotherapy resistance research.

In 
Figure 2A
, a generally upward trend was observed from 2003 to 2016, with fluctuations in the annual growth rate.

Open in a new tab
Annual publications, citations and respective cumulative values in the field of breast cancer immunotherapy resistance from 2003 to 2024. (A) Annual publications. (B) Annual citations (AGR, Annual growth rate).Average Growth Rate:


(1)

As shown in 
Figure 2B
, the number of annual citations in the field of breast cancer immunotherapy resistance experienced a sharp increase in 2018 but declined in 2023.

The geographical distribution of these countries is visualized in 
Figure 3
, where every circle symbolizes a unique country.

As depicted in 
Figure 3A
, the United States takes the lead with 517 articles, followed by China with 415 articles.

Figure 3B
 highlights the recent contributions of countries with nodes closer to red indicating a more recent average publication year and nodes closer to blue suggesting relatively older work.

Figure 4
 demonstrates that Cancer Immunology Immunotherapy, Cancer Research and Cancer Letters have consistently made notable contributions to the field throughout the entire period from 2003 to 2024.

Figure 5
 illustrates a dual-map of journals from citing documents to cited references.

Open in a new tab
Source production on breast cancer immunotherapeutic resistance over time.Figure 5.

Open in a new tabAmong the co-cited references in 
Figure 6
, the highest in terms of citation count is the article by Schmid et al., published in the New England Journal of Medicine in 2018.

Figure 6A
 is a network graph created by VOSviewer, where different colors represent different clusters of co-cited references, circle size represents the number of citations and the number of lines and distance between two circles represent the degree of connection.

Figure 6B
 drawn by CiteSpace software divides the references into seven clusters according to keywords, including: #0 adaptive, #1 tnbc, #2 checkpoints, #3 myeloid-derived suppressor cells, #4 monoclonal-antibody, #5 prognostic signature, #13 combination therapy.

Topic evolution of popular keywords
A total of 493 out of 5,330 keywords appeared at least five times, forming the network graph of 
Figure 7A.

They are grouped into five clusters as shown below:
Figure 7.

As shown in 
Figure 7B
, Clusters 1-3 represent the most prominent areas of interest in the last five years.

Figure 7C
 further illustrates the time trends of keywords within each cluster.

Figure 1
 presents a flowchart depicting the retrieval strategy, data collection and analysis process employed in this study.
